    68.73% turnout

    Overview

    Theresa May has lost her parliamentary majority after calling an election to strengthen it, and has made a deal with the DUP to form a new government. Jeremy Corbyn's Labour party increased its tally by 31 seats. But an anti-Tory coalition is still not viable without the DUP. One constituency is still to declare. The count was suspended in Kensington after three recounts failed to establish a winner.

    Gains and losses

    • Lab +32
    • SNP -19
